ygData.subject: Re: Is eq sexual harrasment racist?
ygData.msgSnippet: Come on John, Some of the guys play female characters for the purposes of fun roleplaying.  It s not like we think that you park yourself in the corner just so
ygData.messageBody:
Come on John,

Some of the guys play female characters for the purposes of fun
roleplaying. It's not like we think that you park yourself in the corner
just so to emote

/em oggles herself
/em pinches herself
/em stares at herself

=). Speaking of which, I have a friend woodelf ranger who has the best
character description that goes along the lines of :

If you are reading this would you please get your hands of my legs and
your head of my breastplate because I am pulling my claw out right now.

Of course I complied the first time I found myself with my hands on her
legs and my head on her breastplate. Suffice to say the next part wasn't
pretty and I found myself cowering behind a counter for my dear life.

Treilanin Loreweaver (male woodelf bard)
Aariel (female High Elf Mage)
And I play a female woodelf bard elsewhere.

On Thu, 7 Oct 1999 kim@... wrote:

> From: <kim@...>
>
> I wonder if any of the guys trying to catch a good look at a
> scantily dressed EQ female have figured out yet that if they
> *play* a scantily dressed EQ female, they can stare at
> themselves for as long as they like and nobody will care. :-)
>
> Not that that had anything to do with my bard being female...
> :-)
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to toren@... with the subject lol.
>
